intro: Stelis huilensis, commonly known as the Huilén orchid, is a terrestrial orchid native to the Andean region of South America. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its compact growth habit and showy, fragrant flowers. The plant typically produces small, greenish-yellow to white flowers with intricate patterns on the petals and sepals. It thrives in humid, shaded environments at high altitudes, often growing in rocky or forested areas. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
